intro: Cyclosorus membraniferus, commonly known as the membranous cyclosorus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thallus that is usually green or yellowish-green, with a distinct, lobed structure. It produces sporophytes that are stalked and bear a single spore capsule at the tip. Cyclosorus membraniferus is often found in temperate regions and is an important component of microhabitats in moist ecosystems.
